intro: Synaedrys carolinae, commonly known as the Carolina thistle. It is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the eastern United States, characterized by its spiny leaves and showy purple flowers. The plant belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is known for its composite flower heads. Synaedrys carolinae typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and woodland edges. Its botanical features make it an important component of local ecosystems and a subject of ecological study.
